definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: Lishangyin's seven-syllable formed another peak after Dufu.
sentences.chinese: 李商隐的七律形成了杜甫之后的又一座高峰。

sentences.english: LI Shangyin was one of the greatest poets with artistic creativity in the history of Chinese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 李商隐是中国诗歌史上最富艺术独创性的大诗人之一。

sentences.english: Individuality and obscurity are the major features of Li's symbolic metaphor.
sentences.chinese: 个性化和朦胧化是李商隐象征喻象的重要特征。

sentences.english: The third chapter analyzes the existing problems of modern translation of his poetry.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，分析李商隐诗歌今译中存在的一些问题。

sentences.english: Only so can one grasp Li Shangyins connotation of thought better.
sentences.chinese: 这样才能更好地把握李商隐“无题”诗的思想内涵。

sentences.english: In this connection, Li Shangyin's poems allow no farfetched comparison or realistic interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 李商隐的诗不可牵强比附，去做指实的说解。

sentences.english: Lishangyin is a famous poet in late Tang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 李商隐是晚唐时期的著名诗人。

sentences.english: His poems have profound influence on and unique value to the future literature.
sentences.chinese: 李商隐诗歌对后世文学有深远的影响和独特价值。

sentences.english: Li Shangyin's unique artistic personality originated from his uneven and complex life.
sentences.chinese: 李商隐坎坷复杂的人生经历形成了其独特的艺术个性。

definition: Du Fu (712-770), great Tang dynasty poet
Lu Zhaolin (637-689), one of the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]
Han Yu (768-824), Tang dynasty essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动 and neoclassical 復古|复古 movements

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Li Qingzhao (1084-c. 1151), southern Song female poet
Lu You (1125-1210), widely regarded as the greatest of the Southern Song poets
Meng Jiao (751-814), Tang dynasty essayist and poet
Li He (790-816), Tang poet and author of 南园十三首
